newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - May 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - May 23.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Friday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Government may be compelled to import rice to stabilise prices if millers do not stop manipulating stocks, say state officials.
Tamil Tiger rebels (LTTE) pound four Sinhalese villages in the northern Weli Oya area with heavy artillery, killing a child and wounding three soldiers and a civillian, security sources say.

A total of 79 senior LTTE fighters killed in nine days of fighting in Operation Jaya Sikuru, security sources say. The military launched the operation last week into the rebel-held northern Wanni region.
Central Bank says Sri Lankans seeking foreign employment now go further afield than the Middle East to Singapore, Hong Kong and Italy.
